page.title: 06CRAFT WORKSHOPS AT ARRETON
page.content: The site known as Arreton Manor Farm was originally part of a small Medieval village clustered around the 12th Century St.George's church. The farm buildings have been converted to provide individual workshops using original old timbers and windows. The craftsmen and women may change from time to time but as an example you may see a potter, leather carver, printer, blacksmith and a restorer of Victorian rockng horses etc. Many fine examples of craftsmanship are displayed and can be purchashed direct from the makers. The Country Craft Workshop at Arreton remains the only working crafts centre on the Isle of Wight.
